ygData.subject: Re: Gems!
ygData.msgSnippet: Ya, I knew that.  Actually, you don t even have to click to pause it, you can just click done and come back.  But, once you log, you have to start a new game.
ygData.messageBody:
Ya, I knew that. Actually, you don't even have to click to pause it,
you can just click done and come back. But, once you log, you have
to start a new game. But why would multiplayer be pointless? In my
mind, they would just make it so you have to start a new game with
another player so that both are starting fresh. I think that it
would be fun :)

I'm glad that they added Gems. I know a while back, many players
were requesting casinos in towns so that they can gamble and play
games. They said that it would be too buggy and exploitable
possibly, but I think that Gems (and other possible future games) is
a good compromise. The best things I can see about it are... Camps
will become much less boring, when you still have to stare at the
spell books with pre-35 casters, waiting for group
assignments/buffing on raids, etc. Although, like you said. People
can die if they aren't paying attention and just playing Gems.

~Beatdrop


--- In eqbards@y..., "Gordon Hughes" <ghughes@c...> wrote:
> You can resume paused games at a later stage. To pause, click on
the game
> window, click "done" and go do something else. To resume, type
/gems and
> click on the paused screen to continue.
>
> I'm not sure if this works if you re-log.
>
> Worryingly enough, I saw a group in Karnors almost get wiped out
last night
> because their Enchanter was busy playing gems while medding.
>
> >Why do you keep saying that you can play non stop. I don't
> >understand what you are saying. Do you mean that there is a way
>to make
> it so the game doesn't reset when you log? I'm >confused.
